rows.label: MultiQuestSummary001
rows.name:
You're needed at King's Falls, where a wounded millesaur
is kicking up a storm. Even other indigens are vacating the
area for safety. ...Say, were those vespers among them?

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary003
rows.name:
This is EXACTLY why I said to be careful! The ruckus at
the Divine Roost woke an especially dangerous indigen
known as a colubrim. You'll need a Doll if you want to
keep your limbs!

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary004
rows.name:
We lost contact with the research team we dispatched to
Lake Ciel after they came under fire from unidentified
craft. Get out there and back them up!

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary005
rows.name:
Someone claiming to be a mercenary warlord heard about
how you took out lupuses and scintimures, and now wants
to take you on in fair combat. Don't pass this up!

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary006
rows.name:
We found what the indigens you took out earlier were so
afraid of—there's a massive ether signature coming from
near the mission area. You'd better head there in a Doll.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary008
rows.name:
We've confirmed visual contact of a new enemy fighter,
and now we need you to glean data by engaging the
target. Of course, if you want to defeat it, too, we
certainly won't stand in your way!

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary009
rows.name:
Seidr threat neutralized. Good wor— What the?! Alert!
Something extremely fast and powerful has just exited a
Growth outpost—it's moving in at six times normal
cruise velocity! We need you to intercept now!

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary010
rows.name:
We have a sabula problem we need you to take care of
ASAP. It seems a renegade oc-serv jolted the creature
awake, and now, it's not very happy. Keep your eyes
peeled for sneak attacks from below.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary012
rows.name:
We were spotted by a Growth patrol team while
engaging a thallus. Looks like it's out of the frying pan
and into the furnace for us.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary013
rows.name:
We've identified the Growth culprits who were using
xe-dom to stir up gravitational anomalies. Let's get out
there and bring their hijinks to an end!

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary016
rows.name:
Clues pieced together from the Beasts' Lair have allowed
us to zero in on a Marnuck unit's current location.
These guys are seasoned fighters that tend to use
teamwork to their advantage, so stay alert!

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary017
rows.name:
The unmanned craft were being remotely controlled by
an enemy outfit based in White Woods's Hilal Stronghold.
We're spread too thin to expend big resources here—
avoid Dolls and take them out with a small, elite team.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary018
rows.name:
A Sylooth couple is on a destructive rampage after a riling
scuffle among their kind. Neutralize the threat before the
entire forest is reduced to twigs! You'll find them north
of Tripod Rock, at the Great Nail!

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary020
rows.name:
Looks like even fish that swim the skies have leaders.
While I'm sure you'd love to go land one, the adseculas
that swarm its lantern are what you really need to be
looking out for...

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary021
rows.name:
Marnucks let a balaena and a scintimure they were
training escape, and now they're both running amok.
The area's roiling with storms and heat waves,
so be careful out there.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary022
rows.name:
Uh-oh. Some vigents the Growth captured have broken
free. They're large, carnivorous, and extremely upset.
This is quite a present they've left for us, huh?
Time to go clean up the mess!

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary023
rows.name:
Our Sylooth skirmish ticked off the leader-class resident
of the Canopied Nightwood, and now it's destroying
everything. Do something before our camp gets cratered!

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary024
rows.name:
Though it was part of our visigel extermination effort,
attacking the cervus herd has angered its leader.
Unfortunately, conflict is our only option here.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary025
rows.name:
We found a Growth facility conducting ether experiments
on live subjects. These foes are hardier than usual, so
engage with Dolls and use Bind to make them vulnerable.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary026
rows.name:
The Drongo Caravan gave us info about the auravis.
Though revered as the forest's protector, the beast is
merciless. Apparently, a saltat's dance has been known
to call it forth.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary027
rows.name:
Though the murra is generally a symbiont to the levitath,
fluctuations in ether density have elicited volatile changes
in the latter's temperament. Defeat these frenzied beasts
before they attack our nearby camps!

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary028
rows.name:
While the garrison was in an uproar, we confirmed that
Dryland Cave Fortress launched several Qmoeva units with a
millepod in tow. We need you to sortie and neutralize
the threat immediately!

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary030
rows.name:
Eradication of the Vasalt has allowed an equally
ferocious species of indigen known as the ictus to flourish.
An ictus roars when it means business, so keep your ears
pricked. Try inflicting Topple to gain an advantage!

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary031
rows.name:
Primordial Wilderness is even more dangerous with hungry lupuses on
the prowl, as starvation tends to amplify their ferocity.
Put them down before something bad happens.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary032
rows.name:
Devil's Colony is now home to a new vesper leader,
and we need you to deal with the entire herd ASAP.
...Where in the heck did these critters come from?

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary033
rows.name:
Emergency request from the Collepedian! A formidable species
of indigen known as the aeviter is holding up resource
transport. All nearby operatives are to respond at once.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary034
rows.name:
There's been a recent spike in indigen pest numbers.
Perhaps it has to do with the toxic trees we dumped?
Regardless, we need someone to step in before the
ecosystem suffers.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary035
rows.name:
The Growth's growing military might is limiting
Pathfinder activity in Cauldros. Take them down a
notch and help expand operations.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary036
rows.name:
We dispatched troops to cull a poisonous indigen called
the papil, but they were attacked by a herd of supposedly
peaceful progen. Get out there and back them up.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary037
rows.name:
Nightglow Forest is a teeming showcase of natural wonder. But
for all the beauty, there are lots of concerns. If you stop to
smell the flowers, for example, they'll probably attack you!

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary038
rows.name:
A Collepedian team overseeing food transport needs help
exterminating some pesky bugs. They specifically asked for
seasoned personnel, so it'll likely be a tough fight.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary039
rows.name:
The camouflage on these indigens makes your jaw drop!
Just the other day, I thought I found a tasty mushroom,
but it turned into some sci-fi horror show before my eyes.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary040
rows.name:
Our camps in Valley of Oblivion are under constant attack from a
group of highly coordinated indigens, and we think the
Marnucks are pulling their strings. Take them out.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary041
rows.name:
This mission's objective is to destroy an autonomous
Growth mech. The enemy sure does seem to have
an inexhaustible cache of weapons, but we'll fix that
problem soon enough—one mission at a time.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary042
rows.name:
We received an enigmatic report from a Pathfinder recon
team in Nightglow Forest reading "Shiny... Floaty..." Head for the
transmission coordinates and get to the bottom of it.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary043
rows.name:
The Growth have dispatched reconnaissance in force,
which we've decided to counter with some of our own.
Shut down their patrol routes and constrict operations.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary044
rows.name:
The Nightglow Forest camp is up to its ears in indigen pests.
Their numbers have exploded lately, though we've yet
to ascertain the cause. Taming this land is no easy task...

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary045
rows.name:
Cinicula attacks on our field teams almost seem like they're
becoming...personal. Could the social capacities of Mira's
insects be much higher than initially thought?

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary046
rows.name:
Regular reports from an operative on patrol suddenly
broke off without warning. Head to these coordinates
and verify the situation, would you? My gut's telling
me something's not right...

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary047
rows.name:
Word from the Dorian Caravan is that large piscinoids
have been causing headaches in the area. Though there's
no immediate risk to NLA, we do have an obligation
to help, so get out there and purge those pests.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary048
rows.name:
Angry indigens have overrun notable sites in Nightglow Forest,
and are now interfering with Collepedian operations.
Take them down—and keep your dukes up!

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary049
rows.name:
Our scanners have found a crucial White Whale
component in Cauldros's Old Ceremonial Hollow.
Eradicate any Growth interference there and
recover the debris right away.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary050
rows.name:
We're planning to perform a distributional analysis of
ether using suids—an indigen that thrives across Mira.
Head to Nightglow Forest and bag a few, would you?

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary051
rows.name:
Plans to build a retreat area are in the works, but nasty
indigens are a problem. The mental serenity of the good
people of NLA rests on your magnanimous shoulders!

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary052
rows.name:
There's been a surge in ether density at Lake Ciel.
We dispatched a team to investigate, but nearby indigens
are in an ether-fueled frenzy and won't let us approach.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary053
rows.name:
Head to Cauldros and apprehend the puges roving the
area—their parts will prove as useful samples for Growth
tech analysis. Oh, and feel free to bust 'em up good—
even broken parts are still useful for research!

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary054
rows.name:
Though the diet of the petramand is primarily composed
of minerals, some mutants with carnivorous tendencies
have appeared. Eliminate them to ensure the safety of
our Landbanker.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary055
rows.name:
A team sent to thin germivore numbers reported some
unusually large specimens in Nightglow Forest. We need you to
verify the sightings and neutralize the creatures in question.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary056
rows.name:
All operatives—including any teams assigned to petramand
extermination—are to immediately set course for
Northpointe Cove and purge the inbound balaena threat.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary057
rows.name:
A report came in reading "Egg of evello is delicious new
Miran delicacy! It definitely much tastier than Nopon!"
...Oookay, then. Still, it seems to be describing a viable
new food source, so we should probably check it out.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary058
rows.name:
A sleeping indigen has entrenched itself in the middle of a
crucial route to Valley of Oblivion, and our logistics guys can't budge
until you clear the road. Watch for attacks from below!

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary059
rows.name:
A Collepedian researching suid infant-rearing angered a
mother suid while collecting samples. Get out there and
quell the threat before the situation escalates any further.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary060
rows.name:
We uncovered a scirpo nest we'll need you to clear out.
Evidence suggests this is the handiwork of the enemy,
but just concentrate on the indigens for the time being.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary061
rows.name:
Overhunting of aprica, who typically rule over the area,
has created an ecological ripple effect that attracted a
nasty type of indigen. Shoot it down and restore peace
to Mira's skies before it causes any more trouble.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary062
rows.name:
We're getting Pathfinder reports of data probes in
Nightglow Forest moving after being planted. Someone
had better get over there and verify the situation.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary063
rows.name:
Marnuck hunting activity has begun displacing progen
herds and other wildlife, which could have detrimental
effects on nearby ecosystems. Go cull any out-of-place
herds you find before the situation gets out of control.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary064
rows.name:
Terebra fur is highly sought after, which has led to
overhunting and an explosion in the saltat population.
It'd be a good idea to get out there and at least clear
out the more aggressive saltats ASAP.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary065
rows.name:
Nearby indigens were angered when we tried to smoke a
dangerous insidia out of a treetop, and now they're on
the rampage. We need you to clean up our mess...

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary066
rows.name:
Indigens have started going berserk in Nightglow Forest, a possible
effect of toppling the Overeds there. We can't let the danger
ramp up further, so please intervene right away.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary067
rows.name:
A rare species of vegetable was found growing in a
monoceros corpse in the sandseas of White Woods, and we
need a sample. Falsaxum are lurking in the vicinity,
so take care.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary068
rows.name:
With its dinosaur-like physiology, the evello isn't quite like
flightless birds of Earth. It also doesn't like strangers,
which is hampering our work. Force is the only option.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary069
rows.name:
A team dispatched to White Woods was decimated in a jacul
attack. Be careful—these indigens are feistier than most!

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary070
rows.name:
White Woods is usually the only place you'd find mizaria
celery, but a specimen was recently located in Primordial Wilderness.
Clear out nearby indigens so samples can be extracted.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary071
rows.name:
The mortifole population in a prominent Nopon tourist
locale is spiking. With the Nopon Highroad nearby,
we've got to act quickly before any real damage occurs.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary072
rows.name:
The North Coast is crawling with indigens, so make tracks
for Valley of Oblivion before the nearby camp is buried. If you take
out the leader—it's the largest one—the rest will scatter.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary073
rows.name:
We're getting reports of a large petramand at the
waterfall west of NLA. No citizens have been
harmed as of yet—let's try and keep it that way.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary074
rows.name:
A team engaging some simius had to pull out mid-battle
after sustaining damage from a flying boulder, believed
to be the work of a Sylooth. Neutralize the indigen
threat before our camps are flattened next.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary075
rows.name:
The Growth are using Marnucks in one of their vile
machinations. Times like these demand that we move first!

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary076
rows.name:
We need you to bring back a duoguill and lophid as part
of an initiative for exploring new indigen food options.
The future of NLA may be in your hands.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary077
rows.name:
The potamus are an indigen species known for its
domestication by the Nopon. Wild specimens are quite
ornery, however, and uncontrollable once agitated...

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary078
rows.name:
The ictus has learned to ambush our operatives from the
cover of spore clouds. Use the new weather-changing tech
to clear the spores and dispatch the indigens.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary079
rows.name:
Though all Growth forces deserve caution, be especially
wary of the bloodthirsty Marnucks. The honed battle skills
of this race make them far more dangerous than most.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary080
rows.name:
You are to neutralize a Growth Doll that has appeared
in the vicinity of NLA. There have also been reports of
rare and vicious indigens in the same area, so stay sharp.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary081
rows.name:
One of our Avalanche successfully infiltrated a Growth
base when some primordial-looking behemoths arrived
and trapped our man. Take down the giants and extract
the operative.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary082
rows.name:
Camouflaged indigens are spreading like wildfire,
causing problems in King's Falls that we need you to
clean up. Go ahead and take care of the thalluses
and adseculas hiding out in the area.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary083
rows.name:
Noctilucent spheres are an odd form of plant life dotting
White Woods—check them out and see what you can learn.
We've heard of xeno activity in the area, so be prepared.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary084
rows.name:
A dangerous giant grex we've had on our threat list has
finally been lured out. The rest is up to you, operatives.
We expect your usual success!

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary085
rows.name:
We located a Marnuck outfit toting resources for the
Growth. Take them out, but keep an eye on the skies—
there are reports of giant piscinoids roving the area.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary086
rows.name:
There's a deadly dilus that needs taking out.
The creature in question is expected to show late at night,
so we'd like you to prepare for a strike then.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary087
rows.name:
Salvaging a wrecked quo turned up some data about
indigens with enhanced ether channeling—the results of
Growth experiments. Take out the Growth troops
at the enclosed locale and get more data.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary088
rows.name:
We've triangulated the location of some Dolls the
Growth pilfered, and it seems Bias troops are already
giving them a test drive. Go destroy their new rides.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary089
rows.name:
A group of mineral-corroding indigens has been sighted in
Primordial Wilderness. It's possible they may latch onto NLA and
cause damage, so make sure that doesn't happen.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary090
rows.name:
We've uncovered the habitat of a leader-class specimen
of turba that we need you to take out. Before you do,
however, make sure you first eliminate the unafulges
hiding in the lava, all right?

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary091
rows.name:
We've detected a lone Sylooth wandering about. Leading
it away peacefully doesn't seem feasible, so take it out
before it stirs up the simius in the Canopied Nightwood.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary092
rows.name:
The bloodthirsty Marnuck forces must be curbed!
We'll bait the small fry away by starting a diversion
outside the enemy fortress—use this window to strike.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary093
rows.name:
An indigen problem is keeping us from exploring the
Silent Mire—one capable of swallowing an auravis whole,
to be exact. Take out the duoguill at the enclosed locale.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary094
rows.name:
Following up the petramand mission, we need your help
taking out a large camouflaged indigen called the
arenatect. Try to avoid appendages and keep your
focus on the creature's main body.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary095
rows.name:
Though we took out those Growth mechs, their support
crew at Jair Fortress is still alive and kicking.
This mission is going to change that.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary096
rows.name:
The forfex, a creature which primarily thrives on shorelines,
was found over in Valley of Oblivion. Giant crabs in Valley of Oblivionn
backcountry? Something's not right here.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary097
rows.name:
Cross-referencing our test results of Silent Mire water with
NLA headwaters has revealed scirpo contamination.
Head to the headwaters and take it out.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary098
rows.name:
A Avalancher team near Mount M'gando needs backup,
as a jacul is giving them a run for their money.
We hear it's nasty, so you'd best prepare for the worst.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary099
rows.name:
We're picking up an Overed presence in White Woods that we
need you to eliminate. Failure to act will likely result in
a disruption of the area's ether balance.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary100
rows.name:
A Avalancher tasked to watch flightless birds was suddenly—
and ironically—attacked by flying fish. Get over there
and pop those piscinoids, would you?

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary101
rows.name:
Studies of the caro species of indigen indicate Nightglow Forest is
in danger of large-scale contamination from toxic agents.
Go there and make the area purgovent-free, would you?

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary102
rows.name:
A leader-class grex attack resulted in some scintimures the
Arms had been keeping for research breaking loose.
Go put them down before they cause some real damage.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary103
rows.name:
Reports of a wandering male virago have been coming in.
It likely lost a bid for the alpha position and was exiled
by the females of its group. Sounds like a bad day that's
about to get worse—we need you to take it out.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary104
rows.name:
This mission is an assassination on a high-profile Growth
target in White Woods. It's a covert operation, so you'll have
to proceed on foot. No Dolls allowed!

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary105
rows.name:
A research team found a purgovent corpse with toxic
progen bones in its stomach. We traced them to a
contaminated progen herd—go contain the issue.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary106
rows.name:
An indigen species with ant-like social aspects has been
discovered. Ecological damage is inevitable should their
population surge, so it's best to preemptively cull them.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary107
rows.name:
We need you to bust some scirpos to fix a water-
contamination issue. Though not directly part of NLA's
infrastructure, the affected area is too close for comfort.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary108
rows.name:
We've received a combat challenge from an unknown craft
whose pilot claims to be one of the "Larsian Four."
Vandham said to take 'em on, so I guess that's that.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary109
rows.name:
A group of cantors pursued by a Growth Doll unit
has struck back by going on a crazed rampage.
Looks like we're on janitorial duty for this one.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary110
rows.name:
A team sent to secure a levitath specimen was ambushed
by Marnucks and decimated. This enemy is no pushover,
so go in fast and hit 'em hard.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary111
rows.name:
Some hills on the outskirts of NLA are now home to
a group of rowdy simius. They've been attacking BLADE
transports, but fortunately, they cry out before striking,
giving us time to flee. I say it's time we stop running.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary112
rows.name:
Some Companion lost supplies to Marnuck raiders—and
we're suffering a commodity shortage as it is. If you
don't recover the cargo, I fear our days are numbered.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary113
rows.name:
Some particularly feculent indigens have been congregating
in Valley of Oblivion. We fear this activity may give rise to new types
of contagions, so sanitize the problem before it gets ugly.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary114
rows.name:
Some unmanned Growth recon craft were seen circling
near the Drongo Caravan. Put them on ice, but keep
one eye out for the nearby caro population.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary115
rows.name:
An outfit of renegade Larsians with no insignia has
begun a string of mindless attacks. Halt their spree
before our camps suffer any more casualties.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary116
rows.name:
We need to wrest control of an important Cauldros water
source from the local indigens. They won't let go of it
easily, so expect some resistance.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary117
rows.name:
Bias beast whisperers are said to use a special incense
to tame suids. It's a facinating topic, but...when your
mission is to wipe them out, that's what you do.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary118
rows.name:
A remnant of the White Whale was located in Waterway
Tangle. Hostile indigens won't let the Testament get close,
so you need to secure the area and inspect the wreckage.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary119
rows.name:
A leader-class insidia has started to attack people—it must
have perceived our biosurvey team as a territorial threat.
This isn't a target we can take lightly, so use caution.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary120
rows.name:
A scan of the NLA outskirts has revealed the presence
of a mid-sized Marnuck squad. Investigate their old
Beasts' Lair base to track their current location.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary121
rows.name:
Neutralization of an Overed has effected changes in the
neighboring indigen power structure. Specifically, a
leader-class auravis is posing a threat. You know the drill.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary122
MultiQuestSummary123
rows.name:
A team in the field encountered a brutal scirpo that's even
larger than a dilus. They lacked the muscle to take it out,
but thankfully, we have you around.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary124
rows.name:
A Avalancher team engaged Growth hostiles in Nightglow Forest,
forcing them to hole up in Cauldros. We need you to
enter their territory, smoke 'em out, and finish the job.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary125
rows.name:
The appearance of those Overeds in Primordial Wilderness caused
at least one Vasalt to enter into a destructive frenzy.
Put it down before it leaves the continent in pieces.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary126
rows.name:
Combat with an Overed has displaced a herd of vivohasts.
They're on the move as we speak, so take them out
before they spark conflict with other indigens.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary127
rows.name:
Toppling those Nightglow Forest Overeds has left other indigens in a
state of unrest. We have an obligation to preserve order,
so pick up these loose ends, would you?

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary128
rows.name:
Our pursuit of a defeated Overed that fled the scene
led us straight into a Growth camp! If we're to continue
pursuing the beast, we'll need to take out the Growth
here first. You know what to do!

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary129
rows.name:
Taking down those petrimand Overeds inadvertently cheated
a Growth Seidr out of his prey. You can guess who
he'll be hunting next, I assume? Take him out, too!

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary130
rows.name:
Multiple cargo containers were taken into a Growth
fortress in Cauldros. Penetrate the enemy's territory and
see if you can find one so we can learn a bit about
this mystery freight.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary131
rows.name:
Camouflaged indigens are giving the Collepedian a hard time
assessing plant distribution in Valley of Oblivion. Go over there and
clear out the problematic fauna.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary132
rows.name:
Some Collepedian were gathering edible plants outside
NLA and unwittingly ravished a suid feeding
ground—sending their Bias keepers into a rage.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary133
rows.name:
We managed to pinpoint the headquarters of some
Growth forces that have been squatting in our orchards.
Cripple their base so we can start harvesting fruit again.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary134
rows.name:
A Collepedian collecting a poisonous species of plant known
as jaharmum fell victim to an angry caecus herd.
Apparently, these creatures don't like sharing food.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary135
rows.name:
A Collepedian tasked with finding joadtanks stumbled onto a
levitath. Unfortunately, it's at the Divine Roost, so the
levitath is going to be the least of your worries...

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary136
rows.name:
Winning back our orchards from the Growth wasn't
enough—now a fruit-loving avian species is showing up,
though only during certain weather conditions.
Go clip their wings.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary157
rows.name:
A field team accidentally opened fire on the kin of a
progen, which responded by destroying the team.
We started this fight—now we have to end it.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary158
rows.name:
A salvage team logged the following report: "Erratic surge
in blatta population confirmed—including the giant ones."
...Yeesh. Everyone hates bugs, don't you think?

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary159
rows.name:
A herd of viragoes in Nightglow Forest are displaying territorial
aggression towards mission operatives. They're leaving us
with no choice but to take them out.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary160
rows.name:
A group of parasitic visigels has been sighted, and a
nearby herd of cervuses has already fallen victim.
Put them down before things get worse.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary161
rows.name:
The instant Jia Miian, the Beloved bit the dust, we detected
a massive Growth Doll making a beeline for the target
area. Intercept the revenge-oriented pilot and destroy it.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary162
rows.name:
The brambloo shoots we found were being transported by
the Drongo Caravan until they became the target of a
Growth raid. It seems we've fanned the flames of war...

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary163
rows.name:
A transport team moving a progen specimen was attacked
by a virago—and an extremely fierce one at that.
They're requesting immediate assistance.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary164
rows.name:
A vigent separated from its group is wandering Valley of Oblivion in
a hunger-induced daze. It's even more vicious than usual,
so we need you to put it down.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary165
rows.name:
A team sent to deal with those sacrifoles was shot down
by a mid-sized Growth battalion at the Scholes
Battlegrounds. Head there and extract the survivors.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary166
rows.name:
Operatives at Qing Long Glade ran into some viragoes
mid-mission, sparking a battle they had to retreat from.
The viragoes are in a hostile state, so go secure the area.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary167
rows.name:
We need operatives at a Bias fortress that's home to
some new Doll models. Go in guns blazing to lure them
out, then test their combat abilities firsthand.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary168
rows.name:
We're trying to get data on the caskets seen at White Woods
from time to time, but camouflaged aeviters make it hard.
Get rid of the indigens and bring back a sample.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary169
rows.name:
The Growth's defensive gun batteries are no more, but
they still retain air supremacy. Down their squad of drone
fighters and regain control of Valley of Oblivion's skies.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary170
rows.name:
A virago had a hostile run-in with a xiphias,
causing the latter to run amok and terrorize the area.
Engage the xiphias ASAP and contain the chaos.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary171
rows.name:
Multiple unmanned Growth drones are being deployed
in Cauldros as we speak. We can't allow the enemy to
further bolster its forces, so go hit the enemy base.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary172
rows.name:
A peculiar discovery was made on Great Washington
Isle—a stockpile of aprica horns, likely the trophies of a
Growth hunting unit. Get over there and dismantle it.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary173
rows.name:
For this mission, we need you to take down a Sylooth.
This creature and its entourage are a walking den of
hostility, so be on your guard.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary174
rows.name:
Operatives were incinerating tectinsula spores when they
were attacked by a sphinx. Sphinxes base superiority
on flame-breathing contests, so it likely felt challenged.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary175
rows.name:
The gravitational anomalies caused by the xe-dom have
inadvertently sent some filiavents on a destructive binge.
They will strip the land bare if we don't act fast.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary176
rows.name:
Ready to put the boot to some Growth? The enemy
has deployed a formidable platoon in a nearby segment,
crippling a supply route. End them and retake control.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary177
rows.name:
The Growth unit responsible for aprica overhunting has
been pushed back to their base in the NLA vicinity.
Let's take them out before they can restock and regroup.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary178
rows.name:
Multiple indigens are rampaging in Nightglow Forest.
The initial cause seems to be a virago which ingested
a poisonous species of mushroom, causing it to
become disoriented and frantic.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary179
rows.name:
A Gularth rampage is underway in Cauldros due to
constant brimstone showers. We can't wait for the
weather to clear up for good—go there and take out
the targets while we have an opening.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary180
rows.name:
We locked down the location of a Growth Doll squad
just outside NLA that was apparently hunting vigents.
Let's turn the tables and make them the hunted.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary181
rows.name:
We assigned a team to track down a Growth unit of
jumbo-sized Dolls, but dangerous indigens are hindering
the search. Clear them out.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary182
rows.name:
We've had reports of an indigen herd entrenched near a
colossal noctilucent sphere. They're attacking anything that
approaches—almost as if afraid of something.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary183
rows.name:
Colubrim alert! The beast is currently on the move and
leaving a trail of destruction in its wake. It's currently
passing over Mount M'gando—see that it doesn't leave.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary184
rows.name:
Data pertaining to a Growth drone test lab was
extracted from a downed Gularth. This is a chance we
can't pass up—infiltrate the lab and report your findings.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary185
rows.name:
Here are the coordinates of a Growth outfit we pulled
from a wrecked Doll. The target is a mid-sized squad
with several support units in tow, so be ready.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary186
rows.name:
Nopon parents curb their children's hoarding with a tale
that says picking five myuena cacti will summon a scary
dragon. Who knew a sabula would actually appear?

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary201
rows.name:
An ultrafauna for which we've had previous reports has
begun attacking Growth, humans, and other elements
foreign to this world. We must prepare a full-scale assault!
[ST:col p1=red ]All operatives, report! A Global Nemesis draws near!

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary203
rows.name:
BLADE efforts to reduce the number of threatening
indigens are going well, but in the process, they've also
inadvertently given rise to a foe that threatens us all.
[ST:col p1=red ]All operatives, report! A Global Nemesis draws near!

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary204
rows.name:
This virtual training program was compiled using your
captured combat data. The BLADE ethos encourages a
rigorous training regimen, so practice up, operatives!

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary205
rows.name:
Care to practice fighting the infernal tainted sphinx?
As this beast's abilities are among the highest of all
indigens on Mira, you might benefit from a round
or two of sparring...

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary206
rows.name:
This program will allow you to engage a pair of
Growth agents in virtual combat—foes you might
remember from a past encounter...

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary207
rows.name:
This is incredible! Thanks to you, we now have the
Larsian prince Ga Derg's combat data on file.
This will let operatives polish their skills even further.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary208
rows.name:
This program will pit you against a Doll, the signature
BLADE weapon. And not just any Doll, either. I'll let
you guess whose combat data you'll be up against...

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary209
rows.name:
The Vita is an amalgam of high-level tech our civilization
normally wouldn't even dream of, let alone reproduce.
Thanks to its pilot, we've been able to compile combat
data, though this facsimile isn't as strong as the real thing.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary212
rows.name:
This program pits you against a pair of unidentified Dolls.
The source, time period, and location of the original data
is unknown due to the supplier's bogus ID.

rows.label: MultiQuestSummary213
rows.name:
This is the combat data of a craft piloted by one who
exhibited great animosity—or more like a mad obession—
towards us. Its strength seems to have been exaggerated
due to the fear of the operative who engaged it.

rows.label: DLCQuestSummary001
rows.name:
There's trouble brewing in White Woods with a group of ovis.
Though the ovis are generally docile, we have orders to
eliminate all potentially dangerous herds.

rows.label: DLCQuestSummary002
rows.name:
Avalanche located the hiding spot of the Growth officer
heading their mechanized battalion. The area is crawling
with indigens, so concentrate on the target for victory.

rows.label: DLCQuestSummary003
rows.name:
Those pesky Bias are now trying to domesticate
auravises. The idea sounds like a long shot on paper,
but we can't risk them succeeding. See that they don't.

rows.label: DLCQuestSummary004
rows.name:
A terminal dropped by a Bias was found to contain data
describing experiments to tame giant piscinoids. Though
the notion is far-fetched, we can't let it come to fruition.

rows.label: DLCQuestSummary005
rows.name:
Nights abounding with absop's swallowtails are said to
signify levitath mating—and too many of those can ruin
Nightglow Forest's ether balance. We need your help here.

rows.label: DLCQuestSummary006
rows.name:
A cloud-like mass of turbas are sailing over White Woods.
The Avalanche can't dent these numbers, so we need a
small group to clear the area around the turbas' nest
so we can send a team in to eliminate the queen.

rows.label: DLCQuestSummary007
rows.name:
A school of scintimures was recently seen in the skies,
which signals the birth of a Gularth in Sunset Falls.
Take out the creature before it can pose a threat to us.

rows.label: DLCQuestSummary008
rows.name:
We received a report of some "living drills" in Primordial Wilderness,
fairly close to NLA. One can only hope this is all
just a big misunderstanding...

rows.label: DLCQuestSummary009
rows.name:
A Growth mech squad's commander has been tracked to
Valley of Oblivion. He doesn't seem to be equipped with a Doll or
other large weaponry at the moment, so go take him out!

rows.label: DLCQuestSummary010
rows.name:
Saltat relationships are grounded in dancing, but what
does that mean for species like the scirpo and dilus?
Whatever the answer, it seems we've got a sticky
dilemma on our hands...

rows.label: DLCQuestSummary011
rows.name:
This one's from the Landbanker—apparently there were
useful supplies mixed into a recently discarded batch
of junk. Go track them down before the Growth can.

rows.label: DLCQuestSummary012
rows.name:
Xeno outfits are rounding up indigens and congregating
in the Growth Antropolis. Something's clearly up—
infiltrate the hideout and put a stop to their plan.

rows.label: DLCQuestSummary013
rows.name:
Indigens outside NLA are exhibiting odd behavior,
and the generally docile saltat is now attacking BLADEs.
Go deal with the unruly wildlife.

rows.label: DLCQuestSummary014
rows.name:
Nightglow Forest is split by a huge river where large reptilian
fauna coexist with various primordial creatures.
Go there and take out the ancient beasts.

rows.label: DLCQuestSummary015
rows.name:
A field team at the Fallen Unknown Ring was attacked by a
group of vigents! The suids our boys were transporting
must have looked like an easy meal.

rows.label: DLCQuestSummary016
rows.name:
A team was tracking what turned out to be a tersqual,
and the chase brought them all the way to Cauldros—
where they stumbled onto a Growth base.

rows.label: DLCQuestSummary017
rows.name:
The gerrid leaves no soil unturned when digging for food,
and a herd recently unearthed a xe-dom in White Woods.
They often feign being inoperative, so don't be fooled.

rows.label: DLCQuestSummary018
rows.name:
The Growth are utilizing falsaxum as natural traps by
dousing the creatures in water to jolt them out of sleep.
Though the concept is crude, we still can't abide it.
